description: phreno- +‎ spasm, from Ancient Greek φρήν (phrḗn, “diaphragm”) and Ancient Greek σπασμός (spasmós, “spasm, convulsion”) respectively.

entries.meaning: (medicine, biology) A blow to the chest which causes the diaphragm to go into spasm, making it difficult to draw a breath.
(medicine, biology) Diaphragmatic spasm, as in hiccups.
